instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..

threads.title: Macbook Air 13 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> stuck loading OS X
threads.message: Have two of them one <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> second <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> macbook pro 13 same symptoms ,start chime try to boot from usb but loading stuck sometimes 1/4 of finishing sometimes full loading but no booting ,I leave all night and still on loading bar ,all lines measure correct

threads.title: Macbook Air 13 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> stuck loading OS X
threads.message: this could be a corrupted ME region.... Upload your backup.....

threads.title: Macbook Air 13 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> stuck loading OS X
threads.message: That is usually the ME region. Was the BIOS messed with?

threads.title: Macbook Air 13 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> stuck loading OS X
threads.message: Thx ye s it was bios me region ,now working fine

threads.title: Macbook Air 13 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> stuck loading OS X
threads.message: is it possible to fix a board if originally came with a damaged/burnt bios? normally to fix the me region u have to read it out, to see what is the ME version, but if its damaged i cant read it, is it possible to figure out based on the cpu or anyu other stuff what me region do i need? cause if i can i can use another bios and change the me region nad serial number

threads.title: Macbook Air 13 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> stuck loading OS X
threads.message: You can use a clean ME region which will fix it. But always best to use original in my opinion.
